incidents.name: SendGrid Plan Changes Unavailable and Payment Errors

incident_updates.body: The billing functionality has been confirmed as properly restored to the SendGrid platform. Restoration of the SendGrid billing functionality took place at approximately 1:30 PM PDT. All services are now operating normally at this time.

In reviewing the stability of the SendGrid platform billing functionality, our team determined that the billing system is showing signs of significant improvement. However, the stability of the system will continue to be monitored until this issue is confirmed to be resolved. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

As of 1:27 PM PDT, the third party involved in this incident has notified that a deployment has been made and it was stated that there is a noted recovery in performance to the billing functionality of downstream impacted systems (Twilio SendGrid). While this recovery should include the SendGrid platform and its billing function, we will continue to investigate the functionality of the SendGrid platform specifically as it relates to provider changes. Until this issue is confirmed as resolved, please be aware that there may still be degraded and intermittent inabilities to change plans (upgrade or downgrade), process a payment or make other billing-related changes within the SendGrid user interface. This incident does not directly impact mail send. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Due to a third party provider incident, the SendGrid platform is experiencing an issue in billing functionality as of 12:03 PM PDT. Users may experience inability to upgrade or downgrade plans, and cannot access the billing page via the user interface. This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Emails to Valid Domains Being Classified as Invalid and Dropped

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have investigated and resolved the issues with emails being marked as invalid and dropped for valid domains. Starting some time during June 27th to July 1st around 10:00 AM PST, customers experienced issues sending to a few domains where emails were incorrectly dropped and marked as invalid. The issue has been resolved and all impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: Errors returned at SendGrid login page at attempted sign in

incident_updates.body:
Starting from 05.50AM PT 06/29/2024 to 09:22 AM PT 06/29/2024, we experienced an issue with the Twilio SendGrid login page. 
Users had received errors when attempting to sign in at the login page and also experienced issues accessing certain v3 endpoints resulting in 500 errors. This had a minor impact on creation of mail send batch IDs. 
This issue has been mitigated and resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix. Users may continue to receive intermittent errors when attempting to sign in at the login page. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 5:50 AM PT on June 29th, our engineers began investigating an issue with the Twilio SendGrid login page. Users may receive errors when attempting to sign in at the login page. This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: DKIM Signature System Misconfiguration

incident_updates.body: Starting at approximately 9:30 AM PT on June 27th, our engineers determined that a subset of SendGrid accounts began to sign processed email messages with incorrect DKIM signatures due to a system misconfiguration. This misconfiguration of DKIM signing may have resulted in failed DMARC when being assessed by recipient servers. At approximately 3:50 PM PT the same day, the platform restored stability to the signing of DKIM signatures for the small subset of impacted accounts. Although new email messages processed after 3:50 PM PT for these same affected accounts will have proper DKIM signing, messages requested for processing during the impact period that have yet to be assessed by recipient servers will be judged based on their misconfigured DKIM signature.

incidents.name: Intermittent suppressions reporting delays

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have investigated and resolved issues with intermittent unavailability of Sendgrid's suppression email server. From 12:00 AM PST to 1:38 PM PST June 13th some customers may have seen delays in suppressions logging in stats, webhooks, email activity, and bounce forwarding. There was no data lost and the issue has been resolved and all impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: Retroincident - Domain Authentication Endpoint failures

incident_updates.body:
Starting around 8pm PST on June 11th, we started seeing an elevated number of 500 errors affecting sender authentication endpoints (such as validating domains and records), but these were not related to mail sending API requests.

Changes are being reverted and no further issues should be seen from now on and moving forward.

incidents.name: Engagement Event Reporting Delay.

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with engagement event tracking has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Our engineers have implemented a fix for all delayed engagement events and they have been now delivered and the system is up to date, we are still monitoring system performance. We will provide another update as soon as more information becomes available.

On June 4, 2024, at 8:39 AM PT, our engineering team began an investigation into an issue affecting engagement event tracking. We are seeing a delay of up to 30 minutes in reporting engagement events such as opens, clicks, unsubscribes, etc. No data is lost, and the data is being reported correctly, just with a slight delay. The team is working on a fix and this does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our team has rolled back unsubscribe events triggered by these recipient servers and the issue has been resolved and all impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: Email Delays on April 8th, 2024

incident_updates.body: Starting 5:00PM PST on Monday, April 8th, a small subset of customers saw a delay in email delivery that lasted up to 18 hours, all emails were sent successfully. Any users who saw any abnormal delay on their delivery could potentially have been affected due to this incident. There were a total of 26,300 emails affected by this incident. The issue has been resolved and all impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: Trouble Editing Scopes On New Teammates Between April 4th and April 5th, 2024

incident_updates.body: Starting 2:00PM PST on Thursday, April 4th, customers who created teammates may see errors when trying to edit those teammate scopes. Our engineers have investigated and fixed this issue for newly created teammates as of 4:30PM PST April 5th. Customers who created a teammate between Thursday and Friday are advised have to delete and recreate a new teammate to be able to edit the scopes. The issue has been resolved and all impacted services are operating normally.

We are working on the issue, and we will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Email Activity Exports Not Being Received

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with Email Activity Feed Export has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers are still investigating this issue. Email activity export emails might not be received by some customers. Users who are triggering an activity feed export from their SendGrid Account may not receive the subsequent email containing the export. Searching in the activity feed still functions as expected as well as the API endpoints for users with the Email Activity add-on.  We will provide the next updates in 1 hour or sooner as they become available.

Starting around 01:00 AM PT on March 18, 2024, our engineers began investigating an issue with email activity export emails might not be received by some customers. Users who are triggering an activity feed export from their SendGrid Account may not receive the subsequent email containing the export. Searching in the activity feed still functions as expected as well as the API endpoints for users with the Email Activity add-on. This does not impact mail send.  We will provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Latencies and timeouts with Whitelabel API

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with the Whitelabel API and Domain Authentication UI has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. Users should no longer be noting latency or 500 level errors when using the Whitelabel API or authenticating their domain within the UI. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 12:40PM PST on March 15th, our engineers began investigating an issue with the Whitelabel API. Users may experience latency and 500 level errors when using this API endpoint. Users may also note similar issues when authenticating a domain within the UI. This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

components.name: API

incidents.name: 404 errors when calling API endpoint /v3/user/webhooks/event/settings/.

incident_updates.body: From around 10:35am PDT to 12:22pm PDT on March 11, 2024, customers experienced 404 errors when calling the API endpoint that returns the oldest webhook ("/v3/user/webhooks/event/settings/"). It didn't affect mail send, webhook posting or webhook settings. This issue has been mitigated and resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

incidents.name: Latency affecting Automations Customers

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with Marketing Campaign Automations has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issue and are continuing to working toward a fix. At this time there is still some latency associated with emails being processed using the Automations feature. We will provide another update in hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix. At this time there is still some latency associated with emails being processed using the Automations feature. We will provide another update in hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 11:36am PT on March 6, our engineers began investigating an issue that is resulting in increased latency among a certain subset of customers. This latency may especially be noticeable for users of the "Automations" feature associated with our Marketing campaigns product. Customers may see a delay of up to 90 minutes when processing Automations, but it is expected that those emails will be processed. The email API endpoint is unaffected. We will provide another update in an hour, or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: New SendGrid Direct Sign-ups Can Experience Login Failures

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with new Twilio SendGrid Direct login failures has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in 1 hour as soon as more information becomes available.
New SendGrid Direct Sign-up can experiencing login failures
New SendGrid Direct Sign-up can experiencing login failures

Starting around 10:14 AM PST on March 4th 2024, our engineers began investigating an issue with Twilio SendGrid Direct Sign-ups.   New user sign-ups may experience login failures. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Mail Send Delays

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with Email Send delays has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Starting around 06:17 AM UTC on the 29th of February 2024, our engineers have began investigating an issue with mail send requests delays for SMTP and API due to one of our servers. We moved the mail trafic to another healthy server around 6:47 AM UTC and we are currently monitoring the mail send performance. However, users may still had some mail delays within the timeframe specified.

incidents.name: Intermittent Mail Send Delays Between 3pm - 3:15pm PST

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with mail send delays has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix. Emails requests that were delayed between 3pm -3:15pm PST will still be delivered. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 3:21 PM PST on February 28th 2024, our engineers began investigating an issue with intermittent delays in mail send between 3pm-3:15pm PST. Users may experience intermittent delays when sending emails during this period of time. This does not impact new mail send requests after 3:15pm PST. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Mail Send Drops and Inaccuracies in Stats

incident_updates.body: Starting around 11:06 AM PT on 02/26, our engineers have investigated some stats inaccuracies and resolved mail send drops. New accounts and subusers created between Thu 02/22 2:49 PM PT - Fri 02/23 4 PM PT that sent mail on Fri 02/23 between 8:15 AM - 4 PM PT would have been affected where about 16% of their emails were inadvertently dropped which would not be shown in the Stats page. The Mail Send issue has been resolved, and impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: Contact SendGrid UI is not loading for users

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have deployed and monitored a fix and confirmed the issue has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Starting around 8:25 AM Pacific Time on Monday 02/26. We began experiencing issues with the sendgrid.com website. Customers may be unable to load Single Sends or Contacts in the UI dashboard of their accounts. In addition, mail send for Single Sends is impacted as well. Our engineering team is investigating the issue and we will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers have identified the issue and are continuing working toward a fix. We will provide another update in one hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix. We will provide another update in one hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 12:06 PM Pacific Time on Thursday, February 22nd, Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with access to SendGrid.com and SendGrid Blog Posts. Users may experience issues with accessing the websites and receive errors. This does not impact mail send. incidents.name: SendGrid Mail Sending Delays

incident_updates.body: After monitoring, our engineers confirmed that changes deployed to correct the identified hardware problem solved the issue and new mail traffic requested to the SendGrid system will not be delayed. This incident has been resolved.
The system is continuing to be monitored at this time as it relates to this incident.  Another update will be provided in one hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers confirmed that delayed emails due to this hardware problem have been successfully dequeued from the system. New mail traffic requested to the SendGrid system will not be delayed due to this problem as changes were deployed to correct the identified hardware problem. The system will continue to be monitored and another update will be provided in the next hour or as soon as possible.

Starting at 3:00 PM PT on February 6, 2024, our engineers confirmed an issue with the hardware related to mail send for the SendGrid platform. Due to this hardware issue, users of the platform may have experienced delays in mail send requests to the system. Our engineering team deployed a change to help mitigate affected delayed traffic at 3:42 PM PT. While this does affect mail send, only a subset of customers sending mail were affected.  We will provide another update in one hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Customers unable to sign-up for Two-Factor Authentication

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with two-factor authentication sign-ups has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
Our engineers have confirmed that this is an isolated incident impacting 2FA emails just for a few customers.  We will continue to monitor throughout the day.

Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix. We’ve identified a small subset of our 2FA emails that are being rejected by Yahoo as suspected phishing.  We will provide another update in one hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
SendGrid Engineers are continuing to investigate this issue, and will update when we have an update or in 1 hour, whichever occurs first.

Starting at 7:16 AM PST on January 23, 2024, our engineers have identified the issue regarding new two-factor authentication sign-ups and are working toward a fix. At this time customers are unable to sign-up for new two-factor authentication or update current ones. We will provide another update in hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix. We will provide another update in one hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting at 3:08 PM PST on January 22, 2024, our engineers began investigating an issue with our systems that is delaying processing and delivery of mail. Users may experience delays with processing and delivery of email messages sent through Twilio SendGrid. This does impact mail send. We will provide another update in one hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Errors when accessing IP Access Management, Sender Authentication and Webhook settings

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with accessing IP Access Management, Sender Authentication and Event Webhook settings at the Sendgrid's User Interface has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in the next 30 minutes, or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 6:00 PM PST on Thursday, January 18th, 2024, our engineers began investigating an issue with accessing IP Access Management, Sender Authentication and Webhook settings at the Sendgrid's User Interface. When accessing those features, customers are returned the error message "We encountered an error. We're sorry, we were unable to load the page." There's no impact to Mail Send functionality. 

We are actively working to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Intermittent Issue with Sendgrid Account Sign-up

incident_updates.body:
Starting around 11:20 PM PST on January 16th 2024 to 5.00 AM PST January 17th 2024 , our engineers began investigating an intermittent issue with the Account Sign Ups. 
A small subset of requests from users would have experienced failures with account signups. 
This issue has been mitigated and resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

incidents.name: Expired certificate for "mx.sendgrid.net"

incident_updates.body: Starting around 10:00 AM PT on 01/15/2024 and lasting until 3:30 PM PT on 01/16/2024, our engineers began investigating an issue with an expired certificate for "mx.sendgrid.net". Users may experience issues with processing bounces, spam reports, list unsubscribes, and inbound parse messages. This did not impact mail send. The certificate has now been updated and no expired certificates remain.
